metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40133 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free(UAF) vulnerability was found in function'vmw_execbuf_tie_context' in drivers/gpu/vmxgfx/vmxgfx_execbuf.c in Linuxkernel's vmwgfx driver with device file '/dev/dri/renderD128 (or Dxxx)'.This flaw allows a local attacker with a user account on the system to gainprivilege, causing a denial of service(DoS).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40133` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1005-dell300x - 4.15.0-1005.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1153-gcp - 4.15.0-1071.81
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1143-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1122-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1077-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1077.82
No subscription required
